required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relative Bioavailability of Two Different Capsule Formulations of Sitravatinib in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-label, Single-dose, Randomized Crossover Study to Evaluate the Relative Bioavailability of Two Different Capsule Formulations of Sitravatinib in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to investigate the relative bioavailability and pharmacokinetics (PK) of sitravatinib free base and malate salt capsule formulations following oral administration in healthy adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC) from time zero to infinity (AUC0-âˆž)
AUC from time zero to the last quantifiable concentration (AUC0-t)
Time of the maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing adverse events (AEs)
Number of participants experiencing serious adverse events (SAEs)

arm_group.description: Period 1: sitravatinib free base capsule on Day 1 of the 15 day cycle Period 2: sitravatinib malate salt capsule on Day 1 of the 15 day cycle
Period 1: sitravatinib malate salt capsule on Day 1 of the 15 day cycle Period 2: sitravatinib free base capsule on Day 1 of the 15 day cycle

intervention.description: Administered as a free base capsule
Administered as a malate salt capsule

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Body mass index between 18.0 and 32.0 kg/m2, inclusive.
2. In good health, determined by no clinically significant findings from medical history, physical examination, 12-lead ECG, vital sign measurements, and clinical laboratory evaluations at Screening and/or Check-in as assessed by the Investigator (or designee).
3. Are able to swallow multiple capsules.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of stomach or intestinal surgery or resection
2. Have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating sitravatinib, and have previously received the investigational product.
3. Participants who, in the opinion of the Investigator (or designee), should not participate in this study.
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
